Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: @RunningMantheCoin I've been thinking more about that table, there are some fundamentals differences between KMD and other platforms that is hard to fit them into those categories. You may want to explain this to the author. First is the question about Token Creation, KMD allows to create independent blockchains that can do atomic swaps with each other and they work as the equivalent of colored coins/tokens on other platforms. So answering the question depends if he means specifically colored coins from the technical point of view, then it's a work in progress, or if he means the purpose of token creation, then KMD assetchains can fit both the token and sidechain categories. Then there's a question about transaction costs: the assetchains  are independent and can decide their own tx costs and pay them in their own coins,  they don't pay kmd tx fees

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Not a side chain

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Beauty is it's a separate network.  That's a very important distinction.

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: exact, even that definition must be taken with a grain of salt, some approximation for fitting into the table at all
